intro: Phyllanthus cyrtostylus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf sandwort, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in compact inflorescences. The species is adapted to arid environments and exhibits a low, spreading growth habit.
